ThingDef.label: miso
ThingDef.description:
A traditional paste made by fermenting soybeans with koji, known for its rich, savory flavor. It’s commonly used in soups, marinades, and sauces, adding a deep umami taste to a variety of dishes.

<color=#E5E54C>Trade considerations:</color>

<color=#E5E54C>Ingredients:</color> Making 5 miso requires 50 soybean with a total value of 55, and sells for 23, giving a <color=#33CC33>52.17%</color> profit per unit.

<color=#E5E54C>Fermentation time:</color> 18 days.

<color=#E5E54C>Caravan trading:</color> Its weight is 0.05 Kg, for a value per Kg of <color=#33CC33>460</color>.

<color=#E5E54C>Profit per day:</color> On average, profit per day is <color=#33CC33>0.51</color> (for reference, Yayo is 0.35).
